title: Frontline Socialist Party lashes Govt. over plans to close down SOEs
byline: The Frontline Socialist Party (FSP) lashed out at the government for planning to close down state institutions or to privatise them.

title: Canada’s supreme court will not inquire into Tamil genocide allegations in Sri Lanka
byline: The Supreme Court of Canada has upheld the Ontario Court of Appeal’s decision, confirming that there will be no further inquiry into allegations of Tamil genocide in Sri Lanka.

title: Influx of pilgrims cause heavy congestion on Nallathanniya-Sripada road
byline: Heavy congestion has been reported along the Nallathanniya-Sripada Road due to the large number of pilgrims visiting the shrine during the long weekend, the Nallathanniya Police said.

title: Over 150 dead in Myanmar and Thailand after huge earthquake
byline: A huge 7.7 magnitude earthquake has hit central Myanmar, according to the United States Geological Survey (USGS).

title: Katukurunda motor races go ahead following Court order
byline: The Court of Appeal yesterday issued an order permitting  the Katukurunda Circuit Race organized by the Royal Automobile Club Asia   to be held on March 29, and 30.

title: Two SC judges decline to hear appeal relating to Karannagoda
byline: Two Supreme Court judges have recused themselves from hearing an appeal filed relating to former Navy Commander Admiral of the Fleet  Wasantha Karannagoda.

title: Musk’s xAI buys his social media platform X
byline: Elon Musk says that his AI venture xAI has acquired his social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter.

title: Exam Dept. denies announcement on 2024 A/L results
byline: The Examinations Department announced that they have not issued any official statement regarding the release of the results of the 2024 G.C.E. (A/L) Examination which were held from November 25 to December 31, 2024.

title: NPP challenges rejection of nominations for three Pradeshiya Sabhas
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP), the ruling party of Sri Lanka,  filed three separate writ petitions challenging the rejection of their nomination papers submitted for the Mawanella Pradeshiya Sabha, Medawachchiya Pradeshiya Sabha, and Damana Pradeshiya Sabha for the Local Authorities Election 2025.

title: Power outage at Power and Energy Ministers’ event in Jaffna
byline: A brief power outage occurred during a meeting attended by the Minister of Power and Energy, Kumara Jayakody in Jaffna today.
